The process of dependent origination [sn: Things that are prone to being grasped
Concentration on the gratification provided by these things
Old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress
The process of cessation of suffering (a: Things that are prone to being grasped
Concentration on the drawbacks of these things
Old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease
The process of cutting off the root of s: A person comes along with a spade and basket
They cut the tree down at the roots, dig them up, and pull them out, down to the fibers and stems
They split the tree apart, cut up the parts, and chop it into splinters
They dry the splinters in the wind and sun, burn them with fire, and reduce them to ashes
They winnow the ashes in a strong wind, or float them away down a swift stream.
